questions.question: The concept of internetworking was initially developed by the US Dept of Defense Advanced Research Project Agency (ARPA).
The primary reason for the development of internetworking was to allow researchers to share information and access remote data.
Internetworking evolved after the creation of individual networks.
A computer network is defined as a collection of autonomous devices interconnected to exchange data.
Logical resources in a network include software-based assets such as databases.
Peer computers in a network can both use and provide network resources simultaneously.
Server computers are designed to primarily provide network resources to other machines.
Peer-to-Peer Networks allow computers to communicate directly with each other without a central server.
Peer-to-Peer Networks are generally considered to have a simpler configuration than client-server networks.
Workstations in a client-server network often require less local memory and storage because they rely on the server.
Computer networks and distributed systems are fundamentally the same thing.
PAN stands for Personal Area Network.
Bluetooth is a standard example of a Personal Area Network (PAN) technology.
Local Area Networks (LANs) are used to connect devices over a large geographic area, such as a country.
Wireless LANs typically utilize the IEEE 802.11 standards.
Metropolitan Area Networks (MANs) are designed to connect devices within a single city or campus area.
An Internet Service Provider (ISP) network is typically classified as a Wide Area Network (WAN).
Protocol layering is the primary structuring method used to divide network functionality into manageable modules.
In a layered protocol stack, each layer communicates only by using the services of the layer immediately below it.
Lower layers in a protocol stack add a header containing control information to the message before transmission.
The Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) reference model consists of seven layers.
The OSI model's layered approach is intended to increase the complexity of network design.
The lower four layers of the OSI model are Transport, Network, Data Link, and Physical.
Data is encapsulated with new protocol information as it moves up from the physical layer to the application layer.
A network message begins at the Application layer and moves down the OSI layers to the Physical layer for transmission.
A header is layer-specific information that defines the functions carried out by that specific layer.
Connection-oriented communication requires establishing a session before any data transfer occurs.
In connection-oriented communication, the system can acknowledge receipt and request retransmission of corrupted data.
Connectionless communication typically has higher overhead than connection-oriented communication.
Connection-oriented communication is generally considered more reliable than connectionless communication.
